Title: Editor
Description:
CPR News is looking for an insightful, energized and experienced manager to join its News leadership team as a Topics Editor. The Topics Editor generates radio features and newscast spots, and innovative digital storytelling from our experienced reporters in Health, Education, Environment and Business beats. The ideal candidate will have experience generating engaging content across multiple platforms and be able to inspire the team’s reporters to even greater storytelling. Essential responsibilities:  Evaluates features and daily news spots after they air/publish, and works with reporters to improve their reporting techniques and storytelling as appropriate. Ensures reporters are focusing on significant topics that support the overall direction of CPR News and meet our standards for journalistic excellence. Sets and manages deadlines for this content, taking into account digital needs, and communicating fully with the newsroom.  Coordinates with CPR News’ interview program, Colorado Matters, to arrange reporter contributions to the show. Prepares and shares beat area monthly coverage storytelling plans with editorial team, and suggests daily news items in daily editorial meetings. Coaches reporters on creative ways to tell stories on radio and digital; sets goals with staff and makes sure professional development needs are met.  As part of the News leadership team, contributes to strategy and direction of CPR News.  Non-standard working hours guaranteed. On call as needed and accountable for establishing backup on-call staff when unavailable. View the full job description.  

Knowledge & competencies:  Minimum of five years of strong journalism experience with features editing, breaking news, meeting deadlines, and management experience strongly desired. Impeccable news judgment and outstanding writing and editing skills.  Demonstrable track record of managing beat coverage with focus on enterprise as well as breaking exclusive stories. Must be able to thrive in an environment that requires juggling multiple tasks and deadlines and have strong organizational skills.  To apply, submit a cover letter that includes where you learned of the job opening, resume, three professional references, and salary expectations to hr@cpr.org with "Topics Editor" in the subject line. Please also include links to samples of your work or projects you have led. Incomplete applications will not be considered. No phone calls or drop ins please. Competitive salary and benefits. Colorado Public Radio is an equal opportunity employer and encourages workplace diversity.

Title: Digital Executive Editor, The World
Description:
Digital Executive Editor, The World The World is a leading American journalism franchise covering global issues on public radio, podcasts and online. The World delivers journalism that is consequential, influential and high-profile. Produced by the combined public media innovators, PRI and PRX, in partnership with the BBC World Service and WGBH, The World reaches more than three million listeners across North America each week and 1.5 million on-line. Our newsroom in Boston is a place where passion and curiosity meet global politics and culture. We strive to tell deeply human stories in creative and innovative ways.   Position Overview As a member of the leadership team of The World, the Digital Executive Editor charts the editorial strategy for The World’s digital platforms, manages all editorial content, supervises the digital editorial staff, and answers to the Digital Publisher and in coordination with The World EP/Editor in Chief. Both editorial leaders share the goal of serving The World’s audience, growing The World’s digital reach and engagement and delivering journalistic excellence across platforms.  The ideal candidate for this role will have a deep understanding of and interest in global issues, experience managing and leading a digital editorial operation and demonstrated success in delivering consequential journalism.  Mastery of digital storytelling and platform fluency is required; audio experience is a plus. This person is steeped in international, current affairs, and aggressively seeks out surprising angles and ideas that help illuminate our interconnected world. They help push the boundaries of global storytelling, and constantly think of beyond-broadcast opportunities for all stories and interviews. A key member of the editorial team, the Digital Executive Editor is industrious, curious, passionate and mission-driven; dedicated to both innovative journalism and the highest standards of editorial integrity.  They actively think about the audience and how the show interacts with them, affects them, serves them, and reaches them across platforms We want someone with superb drive – to be first, to be creative and able to help The World set an original agenda. The show values ambition; the ideal candidate can reliably deliver the kind of high-quality journalism that moves the needle on international issues; engages our audience with the right voice and tone, and generates buzz for The World with audience, stations and in the media industry. The World is committed to bringing new, diverse voices and sources from around the globe to a public media audience; this person will play a critical role in delivering on that promise.  They actively contribute to a work environment that is respectful, safe and where all people are urged to perform to the best of their abilities. Job Responsibilities  Develop a digital editorial content strategy and calendar and define editorial roles and workflows.  Build, manage and mentor a team of digital and social media editors and reporters. Oversee reporting and content creation for TheWorld.org, social and mobile platforms. Communicate and build team buy-in on digital editorial goals and strategy with The World staff, generate content ideas, coordinate with the EIC/EP and manage current news related assignments and longer-term projects. Cultivate and supervise a network of digital editorial contributors. Contribute to the formation of a fully integrated broadcast and digital newsroom, work closely with broadcast colleagues to support development of digital content that extends the reach and visibility of The World. Contribute to all editorial discussions and relevant fundraising efforts with demonstrated knowledge of what increases digital interest and support. Meet company objectives agreed to in funding commitments to The World. Perform related special projects or other duties as assigned. Represent The World, PRI, and PRX in public events and industry settings.  Responsibilities/Essential Functions  60% - Work closely with the editorial team to report, write and edit timely articles and analyses, make freelance assignments, locate partner coverage, produce weekly newsletters and develop special reports/packages in order to meet The World’s editorial objectives and goals. 20% - Day to day and long-range editorial planning for digital projects. 10% - Help determine broad digital objectives and identify high-impact digital opportunities.   10% - Guide day-to-day social media output.      This position is based in Boston, MA. PRI’s The World is an Equal Opportunity Employer and invites and encourages qualified applicants from all walks of life. We encourage everyone to apply. To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter to jobs@pri.org.    

Qualifications  Excellent and demonstrated leadership and management of journalism teams at various levels. Bachelor's degree preferred Superior writing and editing skills, under deadline pressure, for both short turnaround news items and narrative-driven feature content. Demonstrated ability to create and package digital content to grow audience and drive reach and engagement. Exhibit a deep understanding of digital audience behavior including experience using tracking, analytics, and content management systems. Experience with multimedia content is required, audio production experience is a plus. Comfortable working with cutting edge publishing tools and social media platforms. Ability to work in a fast-paced newsroom setting and adjust smoothly to changing assignments. Ability to work closely with editorial, management, promotion, marketing and fundraising colleagues in a collaborative manner under deadline. Candidates must demonstrate excellent organizational, project planning, presentation and time management skills with careful attention to detail. Ability to interact with a wide variety of people using diplomacy, tact and discretion.

Title: Fellowship -- Designer/Digital News Design
Description:
Join the 2019 New York Times Fellowship class as an editor in digital news design.

The digital design fellowship sits in the middle of technology, design and journalism. Fellows will work with reporters, editors, designers and developers at The Times to develop skills as shapers of visual journalism. They will have the opportunity to craft rich story experiences for a wide range of projects, including news and enterprise, across multiple platforms.

Strong candidates will have portfolios that demonstrate strong design work — including an understanding of storytelling techniques and a smart UX sensibility — and experience with web development technologies. Experience with video, audio, photography, illustration, server-side technologies, and/or game mechanics is a plus.

Fellows should be quick learners with creative ideas and should have proven the ability to work collaboratively. The pool of candidates will mainly consist of college graduates, postgraduates or budding journalists of any age who have had previous news internships or equivalent experience.

This is a guild position.

Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States. The deadline to submit an application for this yearlong program is 11:59 p.m., New York time on November 19, 2018.

For more information about the Times Fellowship, navigate here: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/jobs/times-fellowship.html

Title: Editorial Director
Description:
Haven Life is an insuretech innovator, backed and wholly owned by MassMutual, that offers a simple online experience for buying high-quality and affordable term life insurance coverage.

We combine the culture of a startup with the stability and backing of a Fortune 500 company to create an environment that's truly unique.

Our diverse team is comprised of smart, collaborative people who think big, execute quickly and don't take themselves too seriously. We're located in New York's Flatiron District and in case you're wondering, yes, we provide free snacks. Cold brew too.

If you're creative, professional and kind, we'd love to hear from you.

What’s in it for you:

Project ownership
Small collaborative team
Big impact on a huge industry
Startup culture
Big company financial stability
Great benefits, including medical, dental, vision, 401k, commuter reimbursement

Summary
As an editorial director, you will lead and grow our content program. We are passionate about financial literacy, and our content program is one of the key ways we deliver on our mission to make life less hard on a daily basis. In this role, you will be responsible for the ideation, management, execution and evaluation of our content channels. We are seeking someone who is creative, a storyteller and who can demonstrate their skills as a phenomenal writer and editor.

Your responsibilities


Shape, refine, execute and evaluate our ongoing editorial strategy to increase audience and drive user engagement and acquisition
Use data and user research to identify new opportunities for Haven Life’s content channels including editorial gaps, tools, content partnerships, syndication opportunities and more.
Collaborate with, manage and grow our network of content contributors
Work with marketing team to help drive SEO, email, affiliate and social strategies forward
Support marketing team with expansion into new content channels
Quality assure content from ideation, through compliance and stakeholder approval, to publishing

About you


5+ years of experience as a journalist and editor
Excellent project management skills, attention to detail, ability to multi-task, deadline oriented
Team player and an excellent collaborator
Approach editorial calendars with creativity and curiosity
A knack for compelling, unique storytelling
A passion for financial literacy and making this topic more approachable for all
A large network of relevant writers, editors and experts
Solid understanding of SEO best practices as they relate to content creation
Familiarity with Wordpress
Familiarity with customer funnels and how to measure a successful content program
Experience using Google Analytics to measure content performance
Experience writing and editing personal finance content a plus
Experience working with legal and compliance approval processes a plus
BA/BS preferred
Able to work in the US without sponsorship now and in the future

BENEFITS
We have a stellar team of co-workers, a really cool office, and lots of fun activities. Oh yeah, and we pay competitive base salaries and we reward performance. Our salary structure is commensurate with experience. In addition, you will be eligible to participate in our comprehensive benefits program including medical insurance and 401(K).

Title: Fellowship -- Reporter/Visual Investigations/Video
Description:
Join the 2019 New York Times Fellowship class as a member of the Visual Investigations team in our Video department.

Do you have an innate curiosity and a need to dig deeper? Are you proficient at digital research, mining social media and using the web to connect dots that reveal a bigger story? Are you adept at analyzing visual content from satellite imagery, eyewitness videos and airplane and ship trackers? Spend a year with the award-winning Visual Investigations team.

The fellow will work alongside our staff of reporters, cinematographers, video editors and motion designers to break investigative stories and cover the biggest news of the day. The fellow will produce compelling, explanatory documentary and breaking news videos.

Prospective fellows should be proficient in verifying user-generated content and be familiar with open source intelligence techniques. Experience in script writing and video production is a plus.

The most competitive candidates will be college graduates and postgraduates or budding journalists of any age who have both reporting and story research skills. The ideal candidate will be a driver of story ideas in the newsroom, be able to work autonomously and exercise sound news judgment.

Description:

The Times is looking for early-career reporting fellows who are hungry, aggressive, supple writers and creative thinkers who want to throw themselves into a yearlong, intensive journalistic experience.

Our reporting fellows will be assigned to various news and features departments. They will receive reporting assignments and earn bylines on their stories. Title: Senior Writer/Editor
Description:
We're the driverless car company.

We believe in improving people's lives by making transportation safer, more accessible, and more convenient. We're building the world's most advanced software ( https://www.driverless.id/news/video-breakdown-gms-unicorn-cruise-shows-off-level-4-skills-sf-passing-uber-maybe-waymo-0176031/ ) to fuel the driverless cars that safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about.

We seek and embrace diversity in all of its forms. We continuously push ourselves to think differently and take ownership wherever it's needed. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed. If you share our passion for achieving what some say is impossible, join us.

About the role:
Cruise is developing technology that will impact generations to come. Our fast-growing communications team is seeking a Senior Writer/Editor who will write and edit copy intended for a variety of audiences including Cruise employees, our social media channels, members of the media, as well as the general public. The ideal candidate will be able to easily translate complicated technical concepts into language accessible to everyone.

Not only will you be the best writer on our team, you'll be the best editor. We will look to you to tackle the most difficult writing assignments quickly and to complete them ahead of schedule. We'll expect you to raise our game and coach everyone on the team to be a better writer.

Most likely, you'll be one of the most creative people we've ever worked with. While your work will be an important creative outlet for you, it's unlikely that it is your only creative outlet. We're expecting to hire a natural storyteller -- someone who knows how to craft a narrative. We also are seeking someone who can write blog posts and the occasional speech for for our C-level executives. Our goal will be to capture the individual voices of these executives, not to reshape them into someone that they're not.

While we expect we will learn from you, we also expect you will learn from us. Our team believes that by learning from one another, we are stronger and more effective than we would be otherwise.

It's not often that a communicator is given a ground-floor opportunity to help shape what will become one of the world's most told business stories of the next decade. This is that opportunity.

Day-to-day responsibilities include:

Communicate complex, state-of-the-art technology to a variety of audiences.
Research and write engaging copy for a variety of assignments -- everything from social media content, to pitch-emails to journalists, to copy for our employee communications newsletters.
Quickly adapt to last minute asks and changing timelines with flexibility and good humor.
Develop and maintain the Cruise style guide that will be used by writers throughout the company.
Be a sharp copy editor for your own writing, as well as for others.
Collaborate effectively with a variety of colleagues inside and outside of Cruise.
Juggle multiple projects on fast-moving schedules with competing deadlines.
Work closely with C-suite executives and other company experts to create content in their respective voices, while maintaining fidelity to the Cruise brand.

You may be a good fit:

10+ years as a journalist, writer, or editor.
Exceptional writing, editing, and communication skills.
Expertise in AP Style.
Experience writing content that reflects an established voice and tone guidelines.
Strong collaborator who thrives in fast-paced environments.
Self-starter with excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to drive content projects from start to finish.
A superb writer and storyteller who can distill complex ideas into simple and compelling messages, and articulate not just what's happening but why it matters.
A team player who enjoys working with others to accomplish both big and small goals.

Perks of being a Cruiser:
While doing meaningful work is the best perk of all, we also offer the following programs and benefits to support the extraordinary humans who serve as the backbone in making our robot cars go:


The opportunity to solve difficult problems that have immediate and valuable real-world applications
Competitive salary and benefits including 401k Cruise matching program to help you meet your long-term financial goals
Medical / dental / vision, AD+D and Life
Paid parental leave so you can spend time with the newest addition(s) to your family's fleet
Health and Wellness reimbursement
Annual Learning and Development stipend
Flexible vacation and 10 paid company holidays
State of the art equipment for your work station
Healthy lunch, dinner, and snacks

Title: Top News Editor (Editor in Charge)
Description:
Job Description
Reuters, the news and media division of Thomson Reuters, is the world’s largest international multimedia news provider reaching more than one billion people every day. Reuters provides trusted business, financial, national, and international news to professionals via Thomson Reuters desktops, the world's media organizations, and directly to consumers at Reuters.com.

Reuters is looking for an exceptional editor for its Top News Team in the Americas to drive ambitious coverage of the biggest stories of the day, the week and the year.

Based in New York, Washington or Los Angeles, the Top News Editor will be responsible for conceptualizing, developing and presenting top stories for our global media and financial customers. The role requires an outward-looking, curious and collaborative news editor who will spot emerging news themes and push our teams of editors and reporters to deliver. The Top News Editor should also be passionate about finding new ways to tell stories, working closely with pictures, video and graphics colleagues to produce multimedia packages.

This is a hands-on news editing job for an experienced journalist with an ability to work effectively with bureaus across the Americas and colleagues around the world. The Top News Editor will have direct reports.

Responsibilities:
Conceptualizes, develops and edits distinct, ambitious, agenda-setting stories for our Front Page
Works collaboratively with reporters, ensuring a smooth but rigorous editing process
Sets priorities for coverage on top stories; shapes planning of coverage of future events
Identifies running opportunities for stories that Reuters can own from the first headline to the special report
Works with other Top News editors, specialist editors and bureau chiefs to ensure a pipeline of front-page worthy stories in development and that reporters get the feedback they need
Ensures all multimedia elements of a story have been considered, from graphics to pictures and video
Required Skills:
Proven skill at developing and editing enterprising stories, strong news judgment, track record in elevating journalists and stories
Strong organizational, planning and people skills; a competitive streak and consistent ability to secure results
Good understanding of the Reuters news file across asset classes and geographies; ability to see big picture and think ahead; understanding of the Reuters customer base and how clients use news
At least 10 years in reporting and editing at a major news outlet
At Thomson Reuters, we believe what we do matters. We are passionate about our work, inspired by the impact it has on our business and our customers. As a team, we believe in winning as one - collaborating to reach shared goals, and developing through challenging and meaningful experiences. With more than 25,000 employees in more than 100 countries, we work flexibly across boundaries and realize innovations that help shape industries around the world. Making this happen is a dynamic, evolving process, and we count on each employee to be a catalyst in driving our performance - and their own.

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.
Intrigued by a challenge as large and fascinating as the world itself? Come join us.

To learn more about what we offer, please visit thomsonreuters.com/careers.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

Locations
New York-New York-United States of America;Washington-District of Columbia-United States of America;Los Angeles-California-United States of America

Title: News Editor (Commercial Real Estate)
Description:
News Editor (Commercial Real Estate)

Job Description

CoStar has served as a respected source of news for the fast-paced commercial real estate industry for more than two decades. Our award-winning, industry-focused news informs subscribers and complements CoStar’s role as the industry’s leading source of commercial real estate information and data. Fortune Magazine recently named CoStar Group top 100 fastest growing companies in the world. As a member of CoStar’s news team, you will direct and lead our news coverage for one of several key industry beats ranging from Multifamily, Retail, Office, Industrial and Finance. Drawing on your journalism experience, industry knowledge and sources, you will uncover and confirm the biggest stories of the day and deliver news, expert commentary and analysis of the latest trends to our large audience of real estate deal-makers throughout the U.S. You will also enjoy unlimited access to the largest and most comprehensive database of commercial property information in the world for use in your news reports.

CoStar is expanding our news platform with the addition of several news editor positions and additional resources to take our news service to the next level. This is a great opportunity for experienced, tech-savvy, digital-oriented and highly-organized business journalists to take charge and set the news direction for your assigned beat. Previous reporting experience covering commercial real estate is a definite advantage.

Essential Functions:
Take the lead in defining, producing and managing the delivery of original news coverage for CoStar’s extensive online audience of commercial real estate professionals.
Collaborate and coordinate coverage with CoStar’s News Team to develop story ideas, diversify our coverage, and ensure timely delivery and coverage across markets.
Source and develop insightful news content from internal and external data sources and tell data-driven stories in a compelling manner.
Cultivate and manage a bench of knowledgeable sources and expert contributors.
Creatively develop engaging imagery to accompany your reporting.
Attend major industry events and plan and manage special event coverage, (e.g. ICSC’s RECon conference and NAA’s annual conference for multifamily property).
Monitor major industry trends, leaders and companies, including news and social channels, for leads and industry relevance.
Be responsible for the accuracy and veracity of the news you report and follow generally accepted journalism ethics and standards to report the facts, including a commitment to truth, accuracy, fairness and impartiality.
Use traffic and keyword data to gain a better understanding of the news our readers are most interested in to help shape future news coverage.

Skills and Qualifications:
Proven real estate journalist with extensive experience in a high profile editorial news or online content-creating/curating role covering commercial real estate (min. five years.) with regular writing/reporting experience for an online audience.
Results oriented – with proven ability to prioritize, drive and achieve results through self and others while working to deadlines under pressure.
Strong journalism background with proven writing and copy-editing skills, ideal candidates will also be experienced writing in a variety of styles, from straightforward hard news to profiles of industry leaders and longer, analytic pieces.
Candidates should be comfortable in digital media, with a creative flair for images and other visual content to accompany news reports.
B2B media experience preferred.
In addition to having a sharp eye for news and exceptional attention to detail, journalists should have high standards for their work product, with superior attention to details and accuracy.
Strategic mindset and analytical skills with ability to source and develop news from internal and external data sources, including the unmatched property information and data available in CoStar’s proprietary information service.
Excellent web headline and copywriting skills, with a command of AP Style and a deep knowledge of SEO best practices.
Ability to work within a team collaborative environment and manage both up and down management chain.
Basic knowledge of HTML and social media.
Bachelor’s degree or higher required; ideally in journalism, communications, or a related discipline.LI - AA1

CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

Title: Editor
Description:
We are seeking a full-time editor in our Los Angeles or Washington, DC office with 3 to 10 years of professional experience to drive the publication of high-quality, engaging stories on foreign affairs and national security issues for our transformative media platform.

Position Overview::

The editor will coordinate closely with a team of sanctions and national security subject matter experts to pursue groundbreaking news opportunities, craft timely and actionable news analysis, strategically drive coverage, and cultivate opportunities for innovative reporting through features and new products.

The editor will also:
Synchronize reporting to optimize research, business, and marketing objectives;
Guide writers and researchers in identifying and crafting compelling story narratives;

Edit content to ensure the highest levels of quality production;

Imagine and design new media products that engage and educate audiences.

Engaging storyteller who is able to translate complex factual analysis into engaging and informative narratives;

Educational or professional background in international affairs with a demonstrated track record of success in crafting clear, concise, and insightful stories.
Sophisticated understanding of social media content optimization strategies for online publishing platforms is also preferred.


This opportunity is an immediate opening and will be available on an ongoing basis until filled.

Business Overview::

Kharon is a tight-knit, fast-growing information services and technology company. The Kharon platform serves as the definitive resource for financial institutions, multinationals, and government clients globally to understand and manage sanctions-related risk. The company is based in Los Angeles and Washington, DC.

We are experts in assessing and analyzing markets impacted by regulatory risk, sanctioned actors, political upheaval, violent conflict, and corruption. Our deep data approach to research and analysis utilizes open-source research methods, network analysis, and data analytics to generate insights into some of today's most complex policy, regulatory, and national security issues.

The Kharon Brief publishes a continuous cycle of insightful news, analysis, and perspectives on international security topics relevant to commercial, governmental, and media stakeholders.

Kharon is a Camstoll Group company.

Title: Adjunct Instructor, Spies Like Us: Operational Security and Tradecraft for Journalists
Description:
The Annenberg School of Journalism at the University of Southern California seeks a highly qualified adjunct instructor to teach JOUR 499 Spies Like Us: Operational Security and Tradecraft for Journalists.

This course teaches journalists advanced techniques for effectively and safely reporting on sensitive, difficult and potentially dangerous subjects. We will approach the enterprise of reporting from the standpoint of an intelligence officer, borrowing the best tradecraft that spies, federal agents, police officers, and analysts use to find sources, evaluate their credibility, elicit information from them, analyze that information, and protect the agents of information from legal (and perhaps) physical jeopardy. We will re-reverse engineer the tactics, techniques and procedures that are used against journalists with the aim of protecting and hardening the reporting process itself.

We will identify threats to the physical safety and welfare (online and offline) of journalists, threats to the security of their reporting and their communications, and threats to sources, and we will work on a set of best practices to defend and mitigate these threats.

We will practice real-world scenarios, including counter-surveillance detection, source meetings, reporting from the scenes of active emergencies, and basic situational awareness. We’ll use case studies, interview subject matter experts, and experiment with new technology.

By the end of the course, students will be expected to think strategically and creatively about the security of themselves, their sources, their publications and their reporting teammates.

Requirements for consideration include a B.A., B.S., M.S., or an M.A. degree in a related field. Previous teaching experience is desirable. For some courses, outstanding professional experience may be substituted for academic credentials.

The instructor for this class must have at least ten years of experience as a sworn agent of a federal law enforcement agency, or as an operations officer or analyst with an intelligence agency; direct experience dealing with the press in that capacity is preferred, as is a demonstrated commitment to the first principles of journalism. A knowledge of basic reporting practices, investigatory tradecraft, cyber security issues and national security law would be a plus.

The USC Annenberg School for Communication and Journalism is among the nation’s leading institutions devoted to the study of communication, journalism and public relations. With an enrollment of 2,400 undergraduate and graduate students, USC Annenberg scholars, both students and faculty, are defining these fields for the 21st century and beyond.

Title: Entertainment News Intern
Description:
InternshipDate: Oct 25, 2018
Location: Los Angeles, CA, US
Company: Associated Press
The Associated Press is the essential global news network, delivering fast, unbiased news from every corner of the world to all media platforms and formats. Founded in 1846, AP today is the largest and most trusted source of independent news and information. On any given day more than half the world's population sees news from AP.
The Associated Press is offering a paid 12-week summer internship at its Entertainment desk based in Los Angeles in 2019.
The AP Entertainment Intern will contribute to AP’s text and video report and will receive experience and training in both as well as social media production. Based upon skill set, photos and/or interactives may be included. The intern will attend entertainment events, where he or she will work with journalists of all formats.
The intern will be expected to be a fast thinker and show creativity and strong news judgment. A successful candidate will be able to suggest story ideas and angles and see storytelling potential in video, images and text. The intern should be comfortable interacting with a diverse group of co-workers and interview subjects.
The intern will be expected to keep up-to-date with entertainment news around the world, and its relevance to other areas, including general news, business news, politics and sports. Responsibilities will include tracking down information, conducting interviews, monitoring and using social media to find stories and to promote AP’s content, tracking down user-generated content and covering breaking stories and entertainment events, either by phone or going to the scene.
The intern will also work with the desk editors, working on content from around the world, enhancing top stories with multimedia content for AP’s web sites and mobile applications. The intern will also be expected to pitch multimedia enterprise story ideas, and execute at least one during the internship.
The intern will assist in the production of video entertainment stories and work closely with videojournalists and photographers on visual storytelling techniques. Where possible, the intern will accompany staff photographers on assignments, assist with arrangements in the field, and shoot photos.
Training in all formats will include journalism ethics. The intern must become familiar with - and abide by - the AP’s statement of values and principles governing ethics.

current full-time students within two years of earning an undergraduate degree (juniors and seniors) when applying or
current full-time graduate students or
students who graduate December 2018.

Good general knowledge of national and international affairs.
Good writing skills, the ability to recognize grammatical and factual errors and knowledgeable of AP Style.
Must have a keen interest and/or experience in entertainment.

Knowledge of online and social media news venues.
Highly organized and attentive to detail; able to multi-task and manage projects as assigned.
Self-starter with the ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.

Description:

Company: Associated Press
The Associated Press is the essential global news network, delivering fast, unbiased news from every corner of the world to all media platforms and formats. Founded in 1846, AP today is the largest and most trusted source of independent news and information. On any given day more than half the world's population sees news from AP.
The Associated Press is offering a paid 12-week full-time summer data journalism internship based in Washington, DC in 2019.
We are a small team of enterprising developer-journalists distributed across the U.S., and together we work on a variety of data-rich news projects – from drilling into data sets for AP investigations, to developing engaging news apps for big stories such as the U.S. elections, to building newsroom tools that enhance our beat and breaking-news reporting.
We are seeking new ways to tell stories, both in words and in pixels, and our data journalist intern will work closely with graphic artists, designers, video journalists, text reporters and editors to find the story in the data and bring it to life across platforms.
Based on experience and current skill set, the intern will be assigned to either the news applications developers team or the data analysts team. A solid foundation, either in solving problems with code or seeking insight in data, will be key to quickly contributing to either team.
The ability to effectively collaborate, both with other data journalists on the team and with reporters and editors around the AP, along with intellectual curiosity and initiative are essential to be successful in this role. In addition, the intern must be comfortable interacting with a diverse group of co-workers and interview subjects.
The intern will be expected to keep up-to-date with news in the city or region and its relevance to national and international.
Training in all formats will include journalism ethics. Interns must become familiar with - and abide by - the AP’s statement of values and principles governing ethics.
Qualifications:
Applicants must be:
current full-time students within two years of earning an undergraduate degree (juniors and seniors) when applying for the program or
current full-time graduate students or
students who graduate December 2018.
Freshmen and sophomores (first and second year students) are not eligible.
Must be able to show proof of legal authorization to participate in a 12-week internship in the U.S. prior to the start of the internship.
Effective data analysis and reporting skills with a track record of developing strong story ideas from data.
Must be familiar with HTML and web standards.
Relevant experience and training in text is required as well as a secondary visual format such as video, photos or interactive/graphics, data visualizations and 3D animations.
Good general knowledge of national and international affairs.
Must have demonstrated proficiency speaking and writing in the English language.
Good writing skills, the ability to recognize grammatical and factual errors and knowledgeable of AP Style.
A prior journalism internship or experience in media.
Knowledge of online and social media news venues.
Highly organized and attentive to detail; able to multi-task and manage projects as assigned.
Self-starter with the ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.

A 300-word autobiographical essay on this topic: “The Associated Press seeks to recruit and retain a workforce that embodies a wide range of talents, experiences, achievements and journalistic skills. Please describe the qualities and accomplishments you would bring to the company as an intern.”
A resume and cover letter (please include your projected graduation date).

Three to five examples of your data journalism work (links to an online site of your work are highly preferred).

Title: Politics Editor (Editor in Charge)
Description:
Job Description
Reuters, the news and media division of Thomson Reuters, is the world’s largest international multimedia news provider reaching more than one billion people every day. Reuters provides trusted business, financial, national, and international news to professionals via Thomson Reuters desktops, the world's media organizations, and directly to consumers at Reuters.com.

Reuters is looking for an excellent journalist for the role of Politics Editor in our Washington bureau. The editor will take on some of the biggest stories in the world as Donald Trump overhauls U.S. policies almost across the board - from trade and diplomacy to immigration and regulation – and the presidency itself. The populist real estate billionaire has already dramatically changed politics and U.S. relationships with allies and enemies around the world. The Trump-Russia investigation, power struggles inside the White House, and Trump’s volatile relations with lawmakers, business executives and world leaders will all determine whether he succeeds or fails.

We are looking for someone with a deep understanding of politics, policy and business, and can work well with reporters to drive our daily news coverage and enterprise reporting on these important stories. The editor, who will report to the Washington Bureau Chief, will also have a major role in designing and executing our coverage of the 2020 presidential election.

Requirements:
A track record of reporting and writing ambitious, exclusive and high-impact stories
Ability to cultivate sources and gain access to exclusive documents
Strong news judgement and excellent editing skills
Leadership experience and ability to work collaboratively across teams and geographies
Understanding of multimedia elements to enhance stories, from graphics to pictures and video

At Thomson Reuters, we believe what we do matters. We are passionate about our work, inspired by the impact it has on our business and our customers. As a team, we believe in winning as one - collaborating to reach shared goals, and developing through challenging and meaningful experiences. With more than 25,000 employees in more than 100 countries, we work flexibly across boundaries and realize innovations that help shape industries around the world. Making this happen is a dynamic, evolving process, and we count on each employee to be a catalyst in driving our performance - and their own.

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.
Intrigued by a challenge as large and fascinating as the world itself? Come join us.

To learn more about what we offer, please visit thomsonreuters.com/careers.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

Title: Senior Editor
Description:
The senior editor has managing editorial responsibility for content published in The Telegraph newspaper, website and all other outlets. The editor will lead, manage, and inspire a team of journalists as they produce powerful public-service journalism for readers in our local community and region. The editor will ensure that all editorial work is reviewed and approved prior to publication, meets quality standards and serves our readers and communities.
The editor must have the highest journalism ethics and sound judgment; extraordinary skills as an editor; a commitment to understanding the community and key issues it faces; the ability to coach and collaborate with reporters and other editors to achieve high-quality journalism; a deep understanding of and enthusiasm for the modern, digital news ecosystem; a firm grasp of the art and the science of reaching digital readers through search, social media and other distribution channels; a complete commitment to defending the values of the First Amendment, holding leaders and institutions accountable, and speaking truth to power.
Our future lies in digital, and the editor will lead his or her team to focus squarely on serving the measurable needs and interests of digital readers. This will require a passion for reaching digital readers and growing digital readership as well as the ability to ignite that passion in others; the regular use of readership analytics and other data to inform decision-making; and a commitment to and skill in producing exclusive, high-impact journalism.

The senior editor plays a crucial part in coaching reporters to put our readers at the center of everything we do. He or she will discuss every story idea with a reporter or visual journalist, asking who would care about the story. When necessary, the senior editor must be the one to reject ideas or stories that do not fit McClatchy’s mission - freeing the reporter to spend time on work that matters to our readers.

The senior editor will work with the regional editor to ensure that the newsroom develops the right mix of skills and abilities and will develop a structure that encourages teamwork and skill development. The editor monitors reporters’ progress, ensuring everyone has the training and coaching needed to succeed in our audience-focused mission.

Core competencies
Excellent news judgment, a demonstrated ability to see a story and a deep appreciation for our watchdog role.
Highly developed editing, reporting, writing, and social media skills.
A strong understanding of audience engagement, ideally including:
Fluency with analytics and how to apply them.
Skill with digital headlines and an understanding of what content works well on different platforms.
Good working knowledge of SEO practices.
A proven record of driving readership through social media platforms.
Strong interpersonal skills, including empathy (toward readers and staff) and a superior ear for tone.
Ability to ask the right questions and discuss alternatives with a reporter or visual journalist to determine whether a story idea is worth pursuing.
Ability to say no when stories are too incremental, lack value or otherwise don’t meet our standards
Ability to act as a proxy for our readers, asking the questions they want to be answered
Willingness to have difficult conversations with reporters who are not meeting audience goals or core mission goals, and to help them adjust their workflows, story selections or even beats to improve
The ability to lead, direct, collaborate with and coach colleagues throughout the newsroom.
Comfort with a job that will be demanding, fast-paced, constantly evolving, and more outcome-oriented than task-oriented.

Your Contribution:
Move fast. Speak up. Decide and own. Drive change. These are some of the winning behaviors you’ll need for success at Logitech.

In this role you will:

Primary responsibility: lead the development of copy for below-the-line materials, including packaging, websites, e-tail pages, mobile apps, quick-start guides, how-to-video scripts, case studies, emails, and other copy driven materials.
Secondary responsibility: Support the creative team by participating in development of big idea ad campaign concepts and executions.

Ensure projects are completed on time, with an exceptional level of quality.
Key Qualifications:

Exemplary English writing skills. Strong attention to details.
5+ years of experience at a creative/design agency, client-side brands, or as a full-time technology/consumer tech journalist (Online portfolio required.)
Substantial domain expertise, and self-driven interest and curiosity in consumer technology. Quick to see the promise of new technologies and the consumer benefit they can provide.
Skilled storyteller with exceptional communication and presentation skills and experience communicating the benefit of a strategy/idea to large teams.
Able to thoughtfully articulate your position on creative decisions.
Ability to ensure all copy aligns to the brand voice and overall strategic business goals and brand standards.
Ability to make sophisticated technology accessible and understandable to a wide audience with an emphasis on translating product information into consumer-driven messaging.
Understanding of the challenges behind localization, translation, and trans-creation and how they impact creative ideas and storytelling.

A positive collegial team spirit.

Flexibility (within reason) to work outside normal business hours.
SEO experience is a strong plus.

Title: 2018 Atlantic Council-Korea Foundation Journalist Fellowship Program
Description:
About


The Atlantic Council is proud to announce the 2018 Korea Journalist Fellowship Program. In partnership with the Korea Foundation, the Atlantic Council’s Scowcroft Center for Strategy and Security will host the inaugural class of Fellows in Fall 2018. The Atlantic Council Korea Journalist Fellowship is a unique opportunity for early/mid-career US-based journalists working in US media to develop a deeper knowledge of the most critical economic and security issues on the Korean peninsula and in the Asia-Pacific more broadly. By engaging with the next generation of thinkers and policy shapers in Seoul and by working with leading experts in Washington, DC, Fellows will gain a better understanding of current attitudes and shifting perceptions that will affect the US-ROK relationship in years to come. Working with seasoned professionals in South Korea and the United States, Fellows will have the opportunity to broaden their professional portfolios while building lasting ties with their counterparts in Korea and contribute to the Atlantic Council’s ongoing mission of upholding the rules-based international order through engagement, dialogue, and fostering a Trans-Atlantic-Pacific community.


Structure:


The Fellowship program works to increase understanding between the Republic of Korea and the United States. The program will host eight to ten journalists interested in learning more about the Republic of Korea. The Fellowship will begin in fall 2018 and will include three private roundtables in Washington, DC as well as a trip to South Korea. The reception to launch this journalist fellowship will be held on November 1, 2018, and the journalists for the 2018 Class will be selected by the end of November. The Atlantic Council plans to host two roundtables prior to the delegation trip to Seoul, which is tentatively scheduled to happen sometime between December and February. The delegation will meet with high-level government officials and experts in South Korea. A final wrap-up roundtable will occur after the trip. Contingent on their selection as Fellows, journalists will commit to attending all three roundtables and joining the delegation on the ground in Seoul. Fellows should also be prepared to research at least one longer story during the program, and to publish at least one article/broadcast piece after the fellowship, though they will retain full editorial control of said piece. The Fellowship will cover travel, lodging, meals, and transportation for the trip to Seoul. Fellows who work outside of Washington, DC will be responsible for covering their own travel costs to Washington, DC for the private roundtables.


The roundtables will feature a panel of leading experts, academics, and government officials with experience working on economic and security issues in the Asia-Pacific. The roundtables will be an opportunity for Fellows to learn more about significant issues affecting the Korean peninsula, giving them an opportunity to benefit from the expertise of career foreign policy experts before the trip to Seoul. Fellows will be expected to stay up-to-date on any developments pertinent to US-ROK relations and to actively participate during the roundtable discussions.


2018 Program – A Way Forward for the Peaceful and Denuclearized Korean Peninsula


2018 has been a historic year for trilateral relations between the United States, Republic of Korea, and Democratic People’s Republic of Korea, and despite all the developments that have happened thus far, the coming months promise to be equally momentous. As the three countries work toward a peaceful and denuclearized Korean Peninsula based on the agreements laid out in the Panmunjom Declaration, the Singapore Summit, and the Pyongyang Joint Declaration of September 2018, journalists and the media will play a key role in ensuring that both policymakers and the general public are well-informed and share a deep understanding of the process as it develops. As such, the inaugural class of Atlantic Council Korea Journalist Fellows will be provided with opportunities during their fellowship to meet with senior officials, seasoned journalists, and opinion leaders, enabling the Fellows to contribute to the ongoing dialogue taking place both on and about the future of the Korean Peninsula.


October:


Application window opens for Atlantic Council Korea Journalist Fellowship Program


November 1:


Public launch of Atlantic Council Korea Journalist Fellowship Program, with reception featuring Atlantic Council CEO and President Fred Kempe and Washington Post columnist David Ignatius


November 16:


Application window closes for Atlantic Council Korea Journalist Fellowship Program


November 30:


Final selection of 2018 Class of Fellows


November - December:


First and second roundtables in Washington, DC


December - February (TBC):


Delegation trip to Seoul, South Korea


March:


Final wrap-up roundtable in Washington, DC Requirements:Program Eligibility:


Early to mid-career journalists based in the US and working in US media with experience covering foreign policy, international security, or Asian politics in a US media outlet are eligible to apply. Candidates will have the following background:


A working journalist with at least 3 years of experience in media (radio, TV, print, digital) and a portfolio of published/broadcast work.

Interested in covering policy and politics and able to show past work in this area.

No Korean language skills are required.


Application and Selection Process:


A complete application package will include:


A résumé of not more than one single-sided page in length;

A cover letter of not more than one single-sided page in length;

Two letters of recommendation;

Three examples of your work, such as published articles, reports, news reel, etc., including links where applicable.


Please send all application materials, other than letters of recommendation, in a single email with title following the format “[APPLICANT LAST NAME], [APPLICANT FIRST NAME]: Application” to KFJournalistFellowship@AtlanticCouncil.org. Letters of recommendation should be sent directly by your recommender, also following the format of “[APPLICANT LAST NAME], [APPLICANT FIRST NAME]: Application” in the email title. Applicants are responsible for ensuring that their recommenders send their letters in before the deadline.


When sending in your application materials, please follow the below naming conventions:


Résumé: “[APPLICANT LAST NAME], [APPLICANT FIRST NAME]: Resume”

Cover Letter: “[APPLICANT LAST NAME], [APPLICANT FIRST NAME]: Cover Letter”

Letter of Recommendation: “[APPLICANT LAST NAME], [APPLICANT FIRST NAME]: Rec Letter”

Previous Work: “[APPLICANT LAST NAME], [APPLICANT FIRST NAME]: Sample 1”, “[APPLICANT LAST NAME], [APPLICANT FIRST NAME]: Sample 2,” etc.

If the file is a video or audio file that is too large to attach in an email, please feel free to upload it to YouTube, Vimeo, or another streaming service, and mention appropriately in the body of your email.


The application window will close at 11:59 p.m. EST on November 16, 2018 (Friday). Applications that are late or incomplete will not be accepted. Fellows will be chosen by the Atlantic Council’s Fellowship Program Review Committee and notified via email.


Expectations for participants


Participants should be prepared to research at least one longer story during the program, and to identify this in advance.

Each participant will be expected to publish at least one article/broadcast piece after the fellowship.

Editorial control and decisions remain with the journalist.

Create original news stories; gather information for news stories using beat sources, contacts and leads

Title: Senior Editor, LCD
Description:
The Role: Senior Editor, Editorial


The Location: New York, NY


S&P Global Market Intelligence


The Team: Leveraged Commentary & Data (LCD) has more than three dozen journalists and analysts providing news and research to 80,000 plus subscribers worldwide. We are a leading information provider whose success hinges upon producing a premier data and research product.


The Impact: The role will provide coverage of the US leveraged finance markets, which could entail leveraged loans, high yield bonds, private equity, distressed debt, or bankruptcies/restructurings. You will collaborate across LCD's group, reporting and writing both straight news and feature-length stories.


What’s in it for you:

Gain significant insight to the leveraged finance market
Career path that provides growth within sector
Cross-team and global collaboration
Learn about market dynamics
Opportunities to enrich your ability to deliver high-quality news
Opportunities for new and dynamic responsibilities, including reporting mentoring and editorial leadership
Build a robust network of industry and professional contacts.
Increase your understanding of market dynamics, and build your knowledge of the private equity space.
Explore a highly-rewarding career path with room for professional growth, recognition and rewards.
Brainstorm with colleagues who share deep knowledge and passion about the sectors they cover.
Enjoy a casual working environment

Responsibilities:

Provide news and analytical content about current market events. These articles should maintain a high degree of accuracy despite the density of the content, and should reflect an understanding of the market. Additionally, they should also reflect deep understanding of other financial markets and how the credit markets relate back to events in those markets.
Interview major players in the field, including bankers, traders, and investors. In addition to heavy telephone contact during business hours, this job includes extensive market contact representing S&P at conferences, and in source meetings.
Develop/maintain sources within the leveraged loan and related market segments as to stay ahead of breaking news (deal launches, changes in structure, etc.) and to collect insight/perspective from the market.
Conduct research of various print and online sources of financial reports to derive pertinent data. Evaluate data from these sources (financial reports, market interviews, other financial commentaries) to produce comprehensive, cohesive articles.

What We’re Looking For:

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor degree, preferably in area of expertise.
Experience as a journalist covering the credit/debt markets, personal finance, or related experience is a plus.
Strong analytical skills (the ability to discern when a story is merited, to source market sources appropriately and to provide accurate financial figures and facts within the story, amid a high-volume, real-time news environment).
Excellent verbal & written communications skills; technical writing skills are a requirement
Team centric
Technology savvy

interaction with readers.

Success increasing audience, traffic and engagement.

Title: Lead Public Affairs Specialist/Journalist
Description:
Description of Responsibilities:

Ke’aki Technologies is looking for a qualified Lead Public Affairs Specialist/Journalist to provide program and analytical Support to the Air Force Surgeon General’s Office of Public Affairs. This position will assist in enhancing public trust and support and promote global influence and deterrence.

Job duties include:

Assisting in planning, implementing, and evaluating program support for AF/SG Congressional and Public Affairs function.
Providing support specifically focused on rising awareness, visibility, and positively enhancing the perception of the program through materials, reports, and metrics scorecard.
Assisting in the planning, implementation, and development of AFMS social media web and tactical communication plans with an editorial calendar.
Assist in the implementation of the suggested strategies and tactics in support of the main AFMS website and primary AFMS social media accounts.
Assisting with the planning of content development, web operations, and maintenance in support of 76 AF-led MTFs websites and social media accounts.
Providing training and guidance for the launch or dissemination of web-based communication products and materials using industry standard best practices adapted for a Department of Defense (DoD) military environment.
Providing program support as necessary to increase visibility and value of AF/SG Public Affairs and Congressional Liaison efforts.
Researching and editing complex information into documents, presentations, and other mediums targeted toward specific audiences that convey agency policy and positions on a wide-range of issues.
Serving as the primary point of contact for planning and developing news articles, factsheets, photo essays, commentaries and similar products with client and stakeholders.
Advising client and team on work performance and review the quality of all work products and resolving complex problems.
Preparing and coordinating communication within a military organization to include, but not limited to the following: staff summary sheets, technical reports, bullet background papers, and official memorandums.
Providing a monthly social media content plan to AF-led MTFs, which includes; monitoring of social media, maintenance of primary AFMS accounts and AF–led MTF social media sites.
Conducting a thorough communications audit of current social media platforms to ensure the programs are current, creative, effective and reach target audiences..
Providing photography support for AFMS events at the Defense Health Headquarters (DHHQ) Falls Church, VA and in the National Capitol Region as needed.

Must pass a Tier 1 investigation/background clearance
Must be a U.S. Citizen

Title: Executive Editor
Post_Date: # an unknown date more than 30 days ago
Description:
SUMMARY

The Executive Editor at AccuWeather oversees all content initiatives, across all platforms and formats to drive increased digital traffic through engagement, return visits, and positive customer behavior by developing creative stories, videos and news. This person must be an expert in all things related to content and channel optimization, brand consistency, segmentation, analytics and meaningful measurement, and driving direct and indirect traffic. The position collaborates with the operational departments to create the best and most engaging content appropriate for the platforms of AccuWeather especially digital (desktop, apps, and mobile web), TV network, radio, newspapers and all related products. This person must be a dynamic editorial talent with an exceptional background in digital editorial innovation.

RESPONSIBILITIES

The Executive Editor is responsible for all content initiatives in all forms to drive and grow new and current business. This includes:


Ensuring all content is on-brand, consistent in terms of style, quality and tone of voice, and optimized for search and user experience for all channels of content including online, social media, email, point of purchase, mobile, video, print and in-person. This is to be done for each platform within the enterprise.
Being highly creative in developing news stories including unique tie-ins between weather and many interest topics such as food, travel, sports, activities, and agriculture to generate traffic by search, linking, etc.
Mapping out a content strategy, both short- and long-term, determining which methods work for the brand and why. Continuous evolvement of strategy is a must.
The development of a functional content calendar throughout the enterprise verticals and defining the owners in each vertical to particular persona groups. This includes a news desk.
Supervising those that manage writers, editors, content strategists; and be an arbiter of best practices in video production, grammar, messaging, writing, and style.
Directing ongoing usability tests to gauge content effectiveness. Gathering data to make content decisions. Working with Lines of Business owners on their content needs and strategy.
Developing standards, systems and best practices (both human and technological) for content creation, distribution, maintenance, content retrieval and content repurposing, including the real-time implementation of content strategies.
Leveraging market data to develop content themes/topics and execute a plan to develop the assets that support a point of view and educate customers that leads to critical behavioral metrics.
Establishing work flow for requesting, creating, editing, publishing, and retiring content, to provide the latest stories and videos.
Create compelling content through unique, insightful approaches that relate weather impact to the economy and all aspects of human activities
Work with technical team to implement appropriate CMS.
Conducting periodic competitive audits.
Supervising the maintenance of content inventories and matrices.
Participation in the hiring and supervising of content/story leaders in all content verticals.
Creation of a strategy for developing outreach for content partnerships as needed.
Work closely with company's Chief Design Officer to ensure a consistent message across channels.

SUCCESS CRITERIA

The Executive Editor is measured on the continual improvement of customer nurturing and retention through storytelling, as well as the increase in new customers into the enterprise through the consistent development and deployment of content on each platform. Success criteria include:


Positive brand recognition and consistency across chosen published channels.
An increase in defined customer engagement metrics (measured by users taking the desired action…i.e. conversions, subscription, purchase, etc.).
Website and social media traffic growth.
Conversion metrics definition and growth.
Social media positive sentiment metrics.
Customer feedback and survey data.
Increases in key search engine keyword rankings.
Clearly defining content distribution strategies

Primary criteria for success are customer and employee affinity. Success is measured around lifetime customer value, and customer satisfaction

QUALIFICATIONS


Bachelor's degree in English, Journalism, Public Relations or related communications field. Master in journalism a plus.
10-15 years of experience as a respected leader in multichannel digital content creation (publishing, journalism, etc.).
Experience with creating compelling messages for different target demographics.
Expertise in all major business software applications (Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Office, etc.).
HR-related experience including hiring, managing, performance reviews, compensation packages, etc. required.
Audience development and subscription strategies experience a plus.

SKILLS REQUIRED

The Executive Editor requires a combination marketing and publishing mindset, with the most important aspect being to think "customer first". In essence, the Executive Editor is the corporate storyteller that must be empathetic toward the pain points of the customer. Specific skills required include:


Proven editorial skills. Outstanding command of the English language.
Training as a journalist and has a "nose" for the story. Training in how to tell a story using words, images, or audio, and an understanding of how to create content that draws an audience (it is critical that the CCO retain an "outsider's perspective" much like that of a journalist.)
The ability to lead and inspire teams of creative personnel and content creators to achieve company's stated goals.
Skill at both long-form content creation and real-time (immediate) content creation and distribution strategies and tactics.
The ability to think like an educator, intuitively understanding what the audience needs to know and how they want to consume it.
A passion for new technology tools (aka, using the tools you preach about) and usage of those tools within your own blogs and social media outreach. Social DNA a plus!
Clear articulation of the business goal behind the creation of a piece (or series) of content.
Leadership skills required to define and manage a set of goals involving diverse contributors and content types
Project management skills to manage editorial schedules and deadlines
Excellent negotiator and mediator.
Incredible people skills.
Basic technical understanding of HTML, XHTML, CSS, Java, web publishing, Flash, etc.
Fluency in web analytics tools (Adobe Omniture, Google Analytics), social media marketing applications (HootSuite, Tweetdeck, etc.) and leading social media monitoring platforms (Radian6, etc.).
A willingness to embrace change and to adapt strategies on the fly.
Great powers of persuasion and presentation (Visio, PowerPoint)
Experience creating a resource or library of content organized indicating SEO, translations and version control.
Needs to be continually learning the latest platforms, technology tools and marketing solutions through partnerships.
Comfortable with acting as the company's spokesman and advocate via media appearances, interviews, sales calls, trade shows, etc.

The Charlotte Observer is seeking a managing editor to oversee day to day operation of the newsroom.

The managing editor is second in charge of the newsroom and directs day-to-day and mid-range news coverage. The M.E. helps shape the mission and direction of the newsroom and is charged with executing that mission day to day.

Direct our journalism at every step, shaping everything from breaking news to long-form pieces in a way that engages the broadest possible audience.
Use well-developed editing and writing skills and excellent news judgment to help identify the highest potential stories to pursue and to shape our journalism.
Lead the teaching and execution of tools for building audience, including urgency, story choices, visuals, headlines, analytics, SEO and social media.

Articulate and reinforce standards for ethics and professional conduct as well as journalistic excellence and fairness.
Work collaboratively with divisions across the company to develop and evolve products and strategies that diversify our audience and revenue.
Proactively identify and solve problems, innovate and adapt.
Education and knowledge: College degree required. Minimum of 10 years of newsroom leadership preferred. Proven record of growing digital readership and engagement required.
Skills:
Excellent news judgment and a demonstrated ability to see a story.
Highly developed editing, reporting, writing and social media skills. Excellent news judgment and journalism ethics and a deep appreciation for our watchdog role.
A strong understanding of audience engagement, ideally including:
Fluency with analytics and how to apply them.
Skill with digital headlines and an understanding of what content works well on different platforms.
Good working knowledge of SEO practices.
A proven record of driving readership through social media platforms.
The proven ability to work effectively with a wide range of colleagues in managing change.
The ability to lead, direct, collaborate with and coach colleagues of varying experience levels throughout the newsroom.
An interest in and aptitude for storytelling using a broad range of media, including the written word, video, photography, podcasts and other audio, and whatever comes next.
An interest in telling stories using a variety of formats and media, and an enthusiasm for learning new skills and technologies.
Comfort with a job that will be demanding, fast-paced, constantly evolving and more outcome-oriented than task-oriented.

Highly developed communication skills.

Title: Editorial Lead
Post_Date: # an unknown date more than 30 days ago
Description:
Wealthfront is looking for a full-time storyteller to help elevate our brand. We empower people to reach meaningful life goals, like buying a home, saving for their children’s future, and achieving financial freedom. Our clients are largely millennials — they're young, educated, and ambitious individuals who often take unconventional paths and define success in their own terms. We feel there is a unique opportunity to produce original content that captures the hearts and minds of this demographic.
We’re looking for a seasoned writer who will work closely with our Director of Content on a number of different initiatives to drive brand awareness — from stories about our clients to in-depth resources that deliver clear answers to hairy financial questions. You’ll also draw insights from our company’s leadership team and package them in a way that’s accessible and useful to our target audience. Part of your role will be to help shape Wealthfront’s brand voice as we evolve beyond the investing industry to personal finance, financial planning, and broader lifestyle topics.
We’re looking for someone who has a strong editorial background and a knack for developing rich, shareable narratives that engage readers. Our vision is to create a content destination that combines written stories with compelling digital experiences (video, podcast, interactive content elements), and you will be a creative partner in helping bring this vision to life. We are investing in a content distribution strategy so that the content you produce will be discoverable across different channels and communities.
While we don’t want to be just another personal finance brand that talks about tips for managing your money, we do aim to increase financial literacy for our clients. Your job will be to help balance our content to be both educational and inspirational. We’re looking for someone with a sense of intellectual curiosity—you ask questions, get excited by new ideas, and enjoy experimenting with different storytelling techniques. If this sounds like an exciting challenge, we want to hear from you.
This role reports into the Director of Content Marketing.
Responsibilities
Manage day-to-day content creation, from ideation and research to publication. This includes writing original content, repackaging existing content, and collaborating with freelancers.
Help develop and manage the editorial calendar, based on news cycles, seasonality, and consumer search trends.
Shape Wealthfront’s editorial identity, refining our brand voice and making that voice consistent across our owned channels.
Partner with our Consumer Insights team, using their research to inform story ideas that are on-brand and aligned with our target audience.
Collaborate with our Data Science team to develop compelling data stories for clients and media partners.
Continually develop creative ways to differentiate our content.
Requirements
5-8 years of experience writing and editing for consumer audiences, ideally as a journalist — published examples of content required
Demonstrated ability to make complex and abstract concepts feel accessible and entertaining
Experience creating high quality content under tight timelines
Experience working with (and ideally managing) freelancers
Incredibly organized and deadline driven
Independent operator with the ability to work with minimal supervision, but comfortable working cross-functionally and collaborating as needed
Expertise with content publishing platforms (we currently use WordPress, but experience using other CMS platforms a plus)
Nice to haves
Background in financial journalism
Exposure to multimedia content production like video, podcast
Everyone across the financial spectrum deserves to live secure and rewarding lives. In order to successfully serve clients across the United States, the Wealthfront team is focused on hiring team members with a diverse range of backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
About Wealthfront
Wealthfront’s vision is to optimize and automate our clients' finances exclusively through software. We've engineered a platform that delivers highly personalized advice and services including investment management, financial planning, and personal banking.

Wealthfront employees enable our clients to achieve their financial goals by developing sophisticated algorithms and investment strategies, intuitive user experiences and scalable infrastructure to continuously deploy mission-critical code. Join us as we help clients create their roadmap to financial freedom and scale from $11 billion in assets under management to trillions (yes, trillions).
